comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Lieutenant John Porte of the Royal Naval Air Service was selected in February, 1914, to be teamed with an American pilot to fly an enlarged version of a Curtiss Flying Boat, in competition for Rodman Wanamaker's offer of $50,000 to the first team to cross the Atlantic Ocean (Newfoundland to Queenstown, Ireland). [The flight, planned for August or September, 1914, was canceled after WWI broke out.] New York Times story, February 6, 1914: query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9405E4DE113FE6...
